\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src\_demand\_forecast.data.split\_dataset.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{split\_train\_test}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{df}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{DataFrame}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{test\_days}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{30}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ Tuple\DUrole{p,p}{{[}}DataFrame\DUrole{p,p}{,}\DUrole{w,w}{  }DataFrame\DUrole{p,p}{{]}}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Split the data into train and test sets.
The last \sphinxtitleref{test\_days} days are held out for testing.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{df}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}) \textendash{} The input DataFrame containing the data.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{test\_days}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The number of days to include in the test set (default: 30).
use “\textgreater{}=” sign for df\_test

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A tuple containing the train and test DataFrames.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Tuple{[}pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{src_demand_forecast.features:src_demand_forecast.features.build_sku_by_day.sku_demand_by_day}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src\_demand\_forecast.features.build\_sku\_by\_day.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sku\_demand\_by\_day}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{demand\_orders}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{DataFrame}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{demand\_orders\_status}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{DataFrame}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ DataFrame}}
\pysigstopsignatures\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Converts data from SQL to pandas DataFrame.}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Converts ‘timestamp’ into a datetime object and creates a new ‘day’ column with the date.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Creates a cross combination of unique days and unique SKUs.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Defines order IDs with delivery statuses (1, 3, 4, 5, 6).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates the total number of products sold for each pair (day, SKU).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Combines sales data with SKU information.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns the result with columns ‘day’, ‘sku\_id’, ‘sku’, ‘price’, and ‘qty’ sorted by ‘sku\_id’ and ‘day’.

\end{enumerate}

\end{description}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{demand\_orders}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}) \textendash{} The demand\_orders DataFrame.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{demand\_orders\_status}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{pd.DataFrame}}) \textendash{} The demand\_orders\_status DataFrame.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The DataFrame with the sales data.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
pd.DataFrame

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\paragraph{src\_demand\_forecast.models.train\_model module}
\label{\detokenize{src_demand_forecast.models:module-src_demand_forecast.models.train_model}}\label{\detokenize{src_demand_forecast.models:src-demand-forecast-models-train-model-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!src\_demand\_forecast.models.train\_model@\spxentry{src\_demand\_forecast.models.train\_model}}\index{src\_demand\_forecast.models.train\_model@\spxentry{src\_demand\_forecast.models.train\_model}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module contains the code to train a multi\sphinxhyphen{}target model.
The model is trained on the data and then used to make predictions.
The predictions are evaluated using the quantile loss metric.
\index{MultiTargetModel (class in src\_demand\_forecast.models.train\_model)@\spxentry{MultiTargetModel}\spxextra{class in src\_demand\_forecast.models.train\_model}}

\paragraph{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{src_demand_forecast.upload:submodules}}

\paragraph{src\_demand\_forecast.upload.s3\_storage module}
\label{\detokenize{src_demand_forecast.upload:module-src_demand_forecast.upload.s3_storage}}\label{\detokenize{src_demand_forecast.upload:src-demand-forecast-upload-s3-storage-module}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!src\_demand\_forecast.upload.s3\_storage@\spxentry{src\_demand\_forecast.upload.s3\_storage}}\index{src\_demand\_forecast.upload.s3\_storage@\spxentry{src\_demand\_forecast.upload.s3\_storage}!module@\spxentry{module}}

\chapter{Demand Forecast}
\label{\detokenize{index:demand-forecast}}

\section{What is the project about?}
\label{\detokenize{index:what-is-the-project-about}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Products such as electronics, household appliances have varying characteristics and demand cycles. Category managers, responsible for overseeing these items throughout their lifecycle, face challenges in planning purchases, especially when the assortment spans thousands of items. As data volume increases and platform complexity grows, traditional methods of inventory management and demand forecasting become less effective. In response to these challenges, Supermegaretaillite is investing in the development of an automated system, including an ML\sphinxhyphen{}based demand forecasting service.

\sphinxAtStartPar
To preserve the primacy of the source code, the SRC module is loaded in \sphinxhref{https://pypi.org/project/demand-forecast-source}{PyPi} for further use in repositories \sphinxhref{https://github.com/Edipool/Demand\_Forecast\_Airflow}{training\sphinxhyphen{}pipeline} and inference\sphinxhyphen{}pipeline.


\section{How to use this project?}
\label{\detokenize{index:how-to-use-this-project}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This project is deployed on the server and is fully ready to work 24/7.
If you want to use this service, you need to:
1. Open \sphinxhref{http://45.91.8.168:8501}{this} web address.
2. For example, you would like to know the demand for the product with SKU ID 20 for the next 7 days. You should fill in the fields in web service: SKU\_ID = 20, Stock = 10, Horizon Days = 7, Confidence Level = 0.90.
3. Click the buttons:
\sphinxhyphen{} “Get how much to order” to find out how much inventory you need to order from the supplier.
\sphinxhyphen{} “Get stock level” to find out how much stock you will have in 7 days.
\sphinxhyphen{} “Get low stock SKU ID” to find out which products will be out of stock in 7 days.
